main event: A bright unidentified light was observed traveling at a high rate of speed in Sheaves Cove, Newfoundland on 27 March 1953.
interesting points: The light was estimated to be star-sized and traveled at low altitude., A woman reported seeing the light over her barn, which was bright enough to blot out the light of her lantern., Several civilians reported seeing similar lights in the area on different occasions., The sightings were described as being very fast, resembling a large light bulb without any sound., The conclusion of the investigation suggested it was likely an astronomical phenomenon (meteor).
witness description: civilians in the area, including a woman who observed the light over her barn
